intro: Gongrostylus costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican gongrostylus, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are small, clustered, and typically have five petals, often in shades of pink or white. It is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
